intro: Aulacospermum plicatum, commonly known as the pleated spurge, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, pleated leaves that give it its common name. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers clustered in cyathia, which are typical of the Euphorbiaceae family. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats. Aulacospermum plicatum is also known for its ability to tolerate drought conditions, making it a resilient plant in arid environments.
